results.name: Rectangular array:  (row n) = b**c, where b(h) = F(h+1), c(h) = F(n+h), F = A000045 (Fibonacci numbers), n>=1, h>=1, and ** = convolution.
comment: For a guide to related arrays, see A213500.
formula: G.f. for row n: f(x)/g(x), where f(x) = F(n+1) + F(n+2)*x + F(n)*x^2 and g(x) = (1 - x - x^2)^2.
T{n, k) = (k*Lucas(n+k+2) - Fibonacci(k)*Lucas(n-1))/5. - _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 08 2019
example: Northwest corner (the array is read by falling antidiagonals):
mathematica: r[n_]:= Table[T[n, k], {k, 40}]  (* columns of antidiagonal triangle *)
Table[((n-k+1)*LucasL[n+3] - Fibonacci[n-k+1]*LucasL[k-1])/5, {n, 12}, {k, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 08 2019 *)
program: for(n=1,12, for(k=1,n, print1(t(n,k), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 08 2019
